snippet: Six years ago, Ken Budd “saw the impact of small gestures” in Louisiana. Since then, he’s traveled the world as a volunteer. Here, he offers advice for “voluntourists.”
abstract: Travel Q&A with Ken Budd, author of travel memoir The Voluntourist. Photo (M)5
lead_paragraph: IN 2006, after impulsively signing up for the Hurricane Katrina relief effort, Ken Budd was struck by one important question: How much good could he, a 40-year-old magazine editor, actually do there? His skills -- spinning a basketball atop one finger, sarcasm, quoting ''The Simpsons'' -- barely qualified him to scrape paint and push a broom around.

headline.main: Taking a Trip To Lend A Hand
